paper.title: An efficient algorithm for branching bisimulation and stuttering equivalence

author.org: Centre for Mathematics and Computer Science
Centre for Mathematics and Computer Science

paper.venue: International Colloquium on Automata, Languages and Programming
paper.abstract: This paper presents an efficient algorithm for the Relational Coarsest Partition with Stuttering problem (RCPS). The RCPS problem is closely related to the problem of deciding stuttering equivalence on finite state Kripke structures (see Browne, Clarke u0026 Grumberg [3]), and to the problem of deciding branching bisimulation equivalence on finite state labelled transition systems (see Van Glabbeek u0026 Weijland [12]). If n is the number of states and m the number of transitions, then our algorithm has time complexity O(n·(n+m)) and space complexity O(n+m). The algorithm induces algorithms for branching bisimulation and stuttering equivalence which have the same complexity. Since for Kripke structures m⩽n2, this confirms a conjecture of Browne, Clarke u0026 Grumberg [3], that their O(n5)-time algorithm for stuttering equivalence is not optimal.
